title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (St. Croix County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (St. Croix County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: Nine Years Use Of Force Reports
communications.communication:
Hello,

We received your request for nine years' worth of incidents of Use of Force reported to the State of Wisconsin by the St. Croix County Sheriff's Office. This would include any incidents occurring in our jail. There is one Hammond Police Department incident mentioned that we cannot speak to. This is the only report that is already in existence bearing any assemblance of the information you have requested. You will notice it does not contain many of the fields you requested.

Pursuant to Wis Stat §19.35(1)(L) an authority is not required to create a new record by extracting information from existing records and compiling the information in a new format. The records you are requesting are not a record.

Please feel free to contact me with any questions regarding the above information. If you believe the St. Croix County Sheriff's Office is withholding the requested records, you may request the St. Croix County District Attorney or the Wisconsin Attorney General to commence an action for mandamus for release of the records on your behalf. Pursuant to Wis. Stats. § 19.37(1), you may also file an action for mandamus on your own behalf.

Thank you,


[cid:sheriffsiglogo2_1855255d-257b-4278-957c-61a991b79423.jpg]<https://sccwi.gov/>

Tammy Wanchena | Evidence and Records Custodian
St. Croix County Sheriff's Office
1101 Carmichael Rd Hudson WI 54016
T: 715-381-4333 | F: 715-381-4355

Tammy.Wanchena@sccwi.gov

<https://sccwi.gov/>

communications.subject: Re: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Highlands County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Samuel Sinyangwe.

The Highlands County S.O. does not maintain a listing containing the Use of Force data you have requested during the specified time frame. A manual review of reports would be conducted, and any accompanying Use of Force reports would be copied and provided.

The information is reported to the Florida Department of Law Enforcement. They may publish the data you seek on their website.

If you would like to proceed with copies of the Use of Force reports, please notify our Records Unit by email at Records@highlandssheriff.org.

They will prepare an estimated labor fee invoice for submission and pre-payment.

Thank you in advance for your time.

Respectfully Submitted,

Lizette "Liz" Peralta

Central Records Director

Records Management Liaison Officer

Highlands County Sheriff's Office

400 S. Eucalyptus Street

Sebring, Florida 33870



 [cid:fb087908-cea6-4777-bb51-43f2fe3886d3]



Our vision is a safer Highlands County where citizens and law enforcement are joined together, the rights of all persons are respected, and community values are reflected.

-------- CONFIDENTIALITY STATEMENT --------

The information contained in this transmission may contain privileged and confidential information.  It is intended only for the use of the person(s) named above.  If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any review, dissemination, distribution or duplication of this communication is strictly prohibited.  If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply email and destroy all copies of the original message.



Under Florida Law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you do not want your e-mail address released in response to a public-records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact this office by phone or in writing.
